dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice
Class AbstractPushOperation

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.util.AbstractExecutableExtension
      dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice.AbstractPushOperation
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractConfigurablePushOperation
public abstract class AbstractPushOperation
extends AbstractExecutableExtension

PushOperations that are triggered by the PushService must extend this class.

The actual functionality of a PushOperation is implemented via the method doInvoke(AbstractPushEvent). Callers that trigger a PushOperation hand in a AbstractPushEvent via PushService.callSync(AbstractPushEvent, boolean) that is handed over to the PushOperation.

All information exchange to and from the operation to the caller is handled by this event.

A PushOperation can only be triggered when the operation can handle the given event. The PushService checks doCanHandle(AbstractPushEvent) before calling doInvoke(AbstractPushEvent).

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.b

init

public void init(java.lang.String id,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String desc)
Initialize the push operation. Initialized the operation with default order of DEFAULT_ORDER.

Parameters:
id - The unique, required id of the push operation
name - The required name of the push operation
desc - The optional despription of the push operation

                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String desc,
                 int order)
Initialize the push operation

Parameters:
id - The unique, required id of the push operation
name - The required name of the push operation
desc - The optional despription of the push operation
order - The ordering number. Higher numbers denote later execution time

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Each PushOperation is identified by a unique id. The id is handed in by the init(String, String, String) method.

Returns:
The unique id of the push operation (not null)
Since:
2008.b

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
The name of a PushOperation can be used in the GUI to represent the PushOperation (e.g. Handle-Id Wizard). The name is handed in by the init(String, String, String) method.

Returns:
The name of the push operation (not null)
Since:
2008.b

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
The description of a PushOperation can be used in the GUI to represent a tooltip the PushOperation (e.g. Handle-Id Wizard). The name is handed in by the init(String, String, String) method.

Returns:
The description of the push operation (may be null)
Since:
2008.b

getOrder

public int getOrder()
Denotes the order in which operations are run. operations with a higher order run later.

Returns:
the order The order number (defaults to DEFAULT_ORDER)
Since:
2008.b

doInvoke

public void doInvoke(AbstractPushEvent event)
Invokes the push operation.

This method must be overridden in implementations of a PushOperation.

The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
event - The push event
Since:
2008.b

doCanHandle

public boolean doCanHandle(AbstractPushEvent event)
Checks if the push operation can handle the given event.

This method must be overridden in implementations of a PushOperation.

The default implementation returns true.

Parameters:
event - The event
Returns:
true if the push operation can handle the given event, false if not
Since:
2008.b
